intro: Lebeckia pulchella, commonly known as the "Cape gold" or "Cape daisies," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, sunny areas and has a low, spreading habit with hairy leaves. Its flowers are composite, consisting of both ray and disc florets, and it is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Lebeckia pulchella is drought-tolerant and thrives in well-drained soils.
